Detailed Description

FusionNode represents a moveable object with sub-objects.

Each FusionNode can have multiple child nodes, but only one parent node. A FusionScene object handles creation and deletion of FusionNodes; as such no public constructor is available. Each fusion node can also have multiple FusionDrawables attached to it, which will be drawn by the scene.

Remarks:
Nodes are designed to maintain the positions of child nodes relative to their parent nodes. For instance, a 'space ship' node could have 'engine' and 'weapon' subnodes positioned at each corner of the sprite - when the SetPosition() method is called on the 'space ship' node, the 'weapon' and 'engine' nodes are also moved to maintain their positions at the top and bottom of the sprite.
See also:
FusionScene | FusionShip | FusionShipWeapon | FusionShipEngine.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

FusionNode::FusionNode (  FusionScene *  creator  ) 
 

Constructor. Should only be called by FusionScene.

Parameters:
creator The scene which will control this node.
Remarks:
This constructor is private and thus can only be called by scenes and other nodes, which are both friendly classes. Actually, the constructor is no longer private (I decided using friend classes was bad form), but that doesn't mean it should be used outside of the FusionScene / FusionNode based classes!

Member Function Documentation

void FusionNode::_draw (  bool  cascade  )  const [virtual]
 

Draws all attached FusionDrawables.

Used internally by FusionScene.

Parameters:
cascade If this is true, the _draw() will cascade down the graph.

virtual void FusionEngine::FusionNode::_notifyRootNode (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Notifies this SceneNode that it is the root scene node.

Although this is simmilar in functionality to _setInSceneGraph(), is preffered when simply notifying the root node as it assumes no sub-nodes to be attached, and thus has a smaller overhead.

Remarks:
Only SceneManager should call this!

void FusionNode::_requestSort (  FusionNode *  child  )  [virtual]
 

Allows children to request a branch resort when their depth changes.

Sets m_NeedChildSort to true if applicable. Called by children in NeedUpdate().

void FusionNode::_requestUpdate (  FusionNode *  child  ) 
 

Allows children to add themselves to the update list.

Adds a child to the m_ChildrenToUpdate list. Called by children in NeedUpdate().

void FusionNode::_setInSceneGraph (  bool  inSceneGraph  ) 
 

(mainly)Internal method for setting whether the node is in the scene graph.

void FusionNode::_setParent (  FusionNode *  parent  ) 
 

Change the node's parent. Used internally.

Parameters:
parent A pointer to the desired parent.

void FusionNode::_sortChildren (  bool  cascade  )  [virtual]
 

Sorts child nodes by their depth attribute.

This sorts nodes so their position in the scene graph reflects their m_Depth attribute, in other words nodes with a lower m_Depth within a branch are drawn first.

Remarks:
On Efficiancy:
It is more efficiant to use FusionScene::Sort() in FusionScene if drawing isn't done in cascade mode (e.g. by calling mynode->_draw(true);).
Only use this method if you plan on doing something like:
myobject->GetNode()->_draw(true);

void FusionNode::_update (  bool  cascade,
bool  parentHasChanged
) 
 

Internal method to update the Node.

Updates this scene node and any relevant children to incorporate transforms etc.

Parameters:
cascade Force the node to update its children, even if it thinks it doesn't need to. This allows the root node to make the _update() cascade down the graph.
parentHasChanged This flag indicates that the parent form has changed, so the child should update its absolute attributes even if it hasn't changed itself.

bool FusionNode::IsInSceneGraph (   )  const
 

Determines whether this node is in the scene graph.

ie. Whether it's ulitimate ancestor is the root scene node.

void FusionNode::NeedSort (   )  [virtual]
 

To be called in the event of depth changes.

This requests a branch sort from the parent. Sorting is expensive so call sparsely.

void FusionNode::NeedUpdate (   ) 
 

To be called in the event of transform changes to this node that make its derived position, etc. out of date.

Remarks:
This not only tags the node state as being 'dirty', it also tells it's parent about it's dirtiness, via _requestUpdate(), so it will get an update next time round.

void FusionNode::SetPosition (  const CL_Vector2 &  position  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the position of the node relative to its parent.

Parameters:
position The relative position to move to.
Set position will move a node to the specified position relative to its parent, and update the positions of all of the nodes children to maintain their relative positions.
